translated: Praise of the Merits of the Holy AvalokiteÅ›vara Bodhisattva
Collection of Sages of the West
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao Feng Da Fu Shi Hong Lu Qing
I take refuge in the most holy AvalokiteÅ›vara, born from a lotus with the wondrous appearance of a full moon,
Able to bestow fearlessness upon sentient beings, I now praise his merits:
Endowed with all wholesome dharmas, wearing the crown of the great wisdom of the buddhas,
Adorned with the most supreme of blessings and wisdom, I therefore take refuge in the lotus-handed one.
Both cheeks are round and red in color, the nose is straight and wondrously majestic,
Teeth like conch shells and snow, close together and even, the four fangs are level and complete;
The Brahma voice is clear, resonant, and profound, all who hear it give rise to a loving mind,
All the various languages he proclaims are gentle, compliant, and sweet;
To save and liberate all suffering sentient beings,
The guide for benefiting oneself and others, therefore I take refuge in AvalokiteÅ›vara.
Eyebrows like the newly risen moon, body features like true purple gold,
Adorned with garlands of various jewels, all who see are never sated;
The seat spread with deerskin robes, the most supreme and sovereign among the assembly,
All the features of the body are complete, therefore I take refuge in AvalokiteÅ›vara.
The finest and softest cotton cloth for the armpits, maá¹‡i jewel treasures for the earrings,
Adorned with worldly and transcendent treasures, the most supreme, sovereign, and victorious;
All wholesome merits are fulfilled, the great Dharma King of all worlds,
Able to open various skillful means, therefore I take refuge in AvalokiteÅ›vara.
Sentient beings with karmic offenses as numerous as dust motes, for immeasurable eons wandering in cyclic existence,
Bodhisattvas always give rise to skillful means and a compassionate mind, transforming and liberating them all to return to the aggregate of wisdom;
Emitting the light of compassion to illuminate all, using the supreme Dharma to bestow it upon sentient beings,
Universally causing sentient beings to realize bodhi, therefore I take refuge in Padma-hasta.
All the AvÄ«ci great hells, bodhisattvas out of compassion go and manifest their bodies,
Destroying those realms without remainder, the Yama hell wardens give rise to fear;
Those sentient beings with karmic retributions, all of them free from suffering and their offenses are eliminated,
The evil destinies able to burn with the fire of wisdom, therefore I take refuge in Padma-hasta.
Endowed with the power of compassion, wisdom, practice, and vows, manifesting bodies in the desire and form realms,
Having mastery over the Dharma, benefiting beings, the retinue of Yama all rejoice;
Destroying all the objects of evil karma, causing all suffering and distress to no longer arise,
Sentient beings are freed from suffering and attain coolness, therefore I take refuge in the Lotus-handed One.
I now praise the great sage, whose supreme form and appearance are unequaled,
Unimpeded and self-mastered, honored in the three realms, universally bestowing fearlessness upon sentient beings;
Delivering sentient beings and enabling them to escape the ocean of suffering, severing the roots of the three poisons and afflictions,
Causing all to abide in peace and happiness, therefore I take refuge in the Lotus-handed One.
All the multitudes of hungry ghosts, with throats like needles, large bellies, and foul hair,
Such types are extremely numerous, day and night experiencing the suffering of hunger and thirst,
Because of being tormented by the fire of hunger and thirst, they devour each other, giving rise to suffering,
The Bodhisattva, upholding the power of compassionate vows, goes there, manifests his body, and saves and delivers them,
First transforming into various delicious foods and drinks, each one satisfying and nourishing the body,
And then expounding the correct Dharma for them, all of them become free from all suffering and distress;
The power of the bodhisattva's compassion, wisdom, and skillful means is able to enter into all realms of existence,
Benefiting and acting in accord with sentient beings to gather them in, therefore I take refuge in Padmapani.
The body has a great maá¹‡i jewel treasure, always emitting pure and wondrous light,
Universally illuminating the darkness of the world, outshining the sun and moon so that they do not appear,
All the yaká¹£as, rÄká¹£asas, and others who are illuminated by the light all take refuge,
Observing the minds of sentient beings and causing them to end their doubts, therefore I take refuge in Padmapani.
The assembly of the powerful asura kings, fighting and struggling fiercely, are difficult to tame,
The bodhisattva also manifests within that realm, skillfully expounding the Dharma to transform and liberate them,
Having heard the Dharma, they cut off doubts and each gave rise to a kind and virtuous mind.
They were able to bestow the supreme and wondrous Dharma gate, therefore I take refuge in Padma-hasta.
The Bodhisattva once roamed the heavens and entered the palace of a wondrous wheel celestial being,
In accordance with the skillful means of the gate of transformation, that celestial being had nothing to give,
At that time, the celestial being gave rise to suffering and distress, the Bodhisattva then manifested precious wealth for him,
Causing the celestial being's mind of giving to be fulfilled, therefore I take refuge in Padma-hasta.
All those with greed and desire are always burned by the fire of afflictions,
If they see the Bodhisattva's excellent demeanor, they are able to turn their thoughts and contemplate the true Dharma,
Those in the world who are rampant with greed, anger, and delusion respectfully bow to the Great Sage,
The afflictions of the three poisons are eliminated, therefore I take refuge in Padma-hasta.
The realm of sentient beings is boundless, with countless insects and ants,ğŸ”½Bodhisattvas also, with a compassionate mind,
Transform and liberate them through skillful means.ğŸ”½Sometimes in the world, there is famine,
They transform food to save sentient beings,
Causing them to cease their hungry and thirsty thoughts, therefore I take refuge in the Lotus-handed One.
If they see sentient beings in the great ocean, their ship wrecked and about to sink,ğŸ”½The Bodhisattvas, out of compassion, manifest as horses,
Causing them to cling to it and cross over.ğŸ”½Sentient beings riding in a ship in the great ocean,
The Bodhisattvas cause the wind to be as they wish,ğŸ”½Whether favorable or adverse, they save sentient beings,
Causing them all to be free from all fears.ğŸ”½The Bodhisattvas have already left behind the suffering of the three realms,
And perfected the Dharma door of samÄdhi,ğŸ”½And are able to transform and guide all beings,
As numerous as the boundless reaches of space;
Bodhisattvas have already left behind various fears, namely the rÄká¹£asas and various spirits,
PiÅ›Äcas, and all evil ghosts,
Great water, great fire, and thieves, tigers, wolves, and beasts of prey, and weapons,
Illness, poison, and evil spells, up to royal punishments and bondage, etc.;
Bodhisattvas themselves have already attained freedom from these, and then for those sentient beings,
The great guide who benefits both oneself and others, the one with the utmost great compassion and fearlessness;ğŸ”½Bodhisattvas have already perfected all pure practices,
Like the sun and moon illuminating the world,
Praised by humans and gods, the great sage, this is the supreme true pure practice;
Bodhisattvas always abide in samÄdhi, with boundless merit as their support,
In accordance with skillful means, they manifest their dwelling place, residing on Potala Mountain,
The mountain is lofty and vast, and even more wondrous, adorned with various precious treasures,
There are many precious trees, such as dÄ«pyÄ and campaka,
And various exotic birds perch on them, always emitting pure and wonderful sounds,
Thus adorning the abode of the sages, one attains blessings by paying homage and gazing up at them with reverence,
The three heavens of Kuvera, Varuna, and Yama,
The gandharva kings, asura kings, yaksha kings, and various naga lords,
Up to the various types such as the bhutas, whether gods or spirits, all the kings,
Day and night each gives rise to a respectful mind, takes refuge, and praises the true sages,
Having thus praised them, all desires are fulfilled according to one's wishes,
Greatly wealthy, happy, and long-lived, courageous, diligent, and endowed with dignity,
Eliminating immeasurable suffering and distress, even nightmares do not arise,
Up to the time when life is about to end, the Bodhisattva manifests his body to comfort and reassure.
The ocean of merits of the Holy AvalokiteÅ›vara is immeasurable, boundless, and endless,
Even if one were to praise him with a hundred tongues for a thousand eons, one would still not be able to fully express it.
Praise of the Merits of the Holy Bodhisattva AvalokiteÅ›vara
